tool.name: HMCan
tool.description: Histone Modification detection in Cancer samples

validator.message: You must specify a file name.

param.name: min_len
param.label: Minumum fragment length used in the ChIP-seq experiment

param.name: med_len
param.label: Median fragment length used in the ChIP-seq experiment

param.name: max_len
param.label: Maximum fragment length used in the ChIP-seq experiment

param.name: merge_dist
param.label: Merge distance
param.help: Maximum distance to merge single peaks into a region.This parameter should be set with respect to the nature of the mark; narrow marks (e.g H3K4me1, H3K4me3) can cover 200bp-2Kb, wide marks (e.g. H3K36me3, H3K27me3) can cover 10Kb-100Kb.

param.name: input_blacklist_file
param.label: .BED file with blacklist regions
param.help: An example of such a bed file for hg19 can be found here: http://xfer.curie.fr/get/GaQHuEopJTw/hg19-blacklist.bed

param.name: genome_selector
param.label: Select the version of the genome under study

param.name: print_wig
param.label: Print density profil in WIG file

param.name: print_posterior_proba
param.label: Print bins posterior probabilites in WIG format

param.name: iteration_score_threshold
param.label: Iteration score threshold
param.help: minimum score to accept a peak into the next iteration

param.name: final_score_threshold
param.label: Score threshold
param.help: score threshold to report peak or regions

configfiles.configfile:
[general]
window = step = outputDir = . chrFiles = $genome[ 'genome_path' ] chrLenFile = $genome[ 'chr_len_file' ] gemMappabilityFile = $genome[ 'mappability' ]

tool.help:
**What it does**
HMCan detects histone modifications in cancer samples.
**Cite HMCan**
If you use this tool, please cite : HMCan: a method for detecting chromatin modifications in cancer samples using ChIP-seq data.Haitham Ashoor; Aurelie Herault; Aurelie Kamoun; Francois Radvanyi; Vladimir B. Bajic; Emmanuel Barillot; Valentina Boeva.Bioinformatics 2013; doi: 10.1093/bioinformatics/btt524
